(Toungoo) is a town and district in
Taungoo is about 275 km from Yangon. The old road to Taungoo took about 6-7 hr. The new road makes it only 3-4 hr.

value: Taungoo is halfway to Mandalay from southern destinations, including Bago. The track is rough in places, but it is far from the most uncomfortable rail journey in the country.  The meals are unexceptional (try the pork noodles), but getting to the meal car can be an interesting experience.

It is the mid-way to Yangon or Mandalay if you want to go by car. Good for your night stop and rest. Tourists stop overnight at Taungoo when they travel from Golden Rock to Inle or Mandalay by hire car.

value: content=The name of a mountain, and the lady who is said to guard it. The mountain is highly regarded by Karen Christians. Access through the old British hill station town of Thantaung Gyi (pronounced "than down gee") (NB this is not the same town as the newer relocated Than Taung at the bottom of the mountain). There have been reports that the area is closed, however it was opened in June 2013, passport check before entering the area. There are sleeping rooms at a chapel on the premises (about 2,000 kyat). There are several routes up and down, best to hire a motorcycle driver in Taungoo (16,000 kyat). The trip takes about 2 hr one-way, through teak forests. Coffee plantation at the top. Lots of armed forces in evidence, however the checkpoint is by a welcoming tourism ministry. They might ask your religion.
There is a small restaurant with outstanding fishhead soup (

) between Happy Restaurant and the mountain. Look for a small building with two tables and a baby hammock inside. Ask prices first, some restaurants have been rumored to charge more than 2,500 kyat for a basic local meal, which the local people consider to be scandalous.
There is a local pick-up that goes up the mountain, but it only runs in the early morning.
is about 2 hr from Taungoo, if you love nature and elephants.
directions=In the north part of town, and in the middle of the action, just north of the market

content=Mostly local people stay here, but if you are on a budget, ignore what Lonely Planet says, they do have a license for foreigners. Accommodation is basic and the screened upper parts of the walls do not allow for a lot of privacy, but it does let in the breeze and keep the mosquitoes out. The staff is extremely helpful and knowledgeable. There are two Internet cafes next to the hotel. Taxi motorcycles are on the corner a block away towards the church. There is a reasonably priced local coffee shop they can steer you to from the hotel, best take a motorcycle taxi. There is a beer garden three blocks away, on a side street, turn north before you get to the church. Do not be fooled by the "beer garden" part of it, there is excellent food, and a generator to keep the beer cold for power failures, so you can find the restaurant by following the lights from the main road, or get back in the dark if the surrounding area loses power.
name=Myanmar Beauty Guest House II, III & IV
directions=At the south end of the main drag, next to a rice paddy
content=Lonely Planet raves about the rice paddy and teak floors.
